channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The economy is turbulent for influencers, too — here's how you might see it online
item.description: Seesawing tariffs and turbulent financial markets are playing out on social media feeds, impacting the multibillion-dollar influencer industry in what...

item.title: On super hot days, this insurance plan pays out cash for lost wages
item.description: It's called parametric insurance, it offers protection for climate-related wage losses and it's gaining ground in India.

item.title: Israel strikes Syria's capital Damascus
item.description: The Israel military said targets included a Syrian military compound in Damascus as well as a target near the Syrian presidential palace. Israel's def...

item.title: Greetings from New Delhi, India, where performing monkeys spark delight -- and ambivalence
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Democratic senators raise concerns about a new Trump citizenship data system
item.description: After NPR reported on a Department of Homeland Security tool to check the citizenship of registered voters, three U.S. senators are expressing concern...

item.title: 7/16: CBS Morning News
item.description: President Trump says he doesn't understand interest in Epstein case, calls it boring; Study finds over 40% of young adults say schools and mentors are...

item.title: Fans say new romance bookstores and online groups are giving the genre some overdue respect
item.description: Romance novels aren’t just guilty pleasures anymore. Fans are connecting through social media, book clubs and at a growing number of romance-only book...

item.title: Texas National Guard continues flood response with Czech team joining effort
item.description: Texas and the Czech Republic have had a military relationship since 1993 as part of the National Guard Bureau's State Partnership Program pairing stat...

item.title: At least 20 killed in crush at US-backed GHF aid site in Gaza
item.description: For the first time, the Israel and US-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation confirms deaths at one of its sites.

item.title: US deports five 'barbaric' migrants to Eswatini
item.description: The five people convicted of serious crimes come from Vietnam, Jamaica, Laos, Cuba and Yemen, the US says.

item.title: Trump asked GOP lawmakers if he should fire Fed Chair Jerome Powell, sources say
item.description: President Trump has lashed out against Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell for weeks.

item.title: Skeleton of medieval knight found under former ice cream parlor
item.description: The site where the remains were found was once home to a beloved ice cream shop.

item.title: Canada's PM wants to fast-track 'nation building' – but can he convince indigenous First Nations?
item.description: Indigenous communities have launched a legal challenge against a federal law that would fast-track resource development projects.

item.title: Three jailed over murder of Swedish hip-hop star in car park
item.description: The hip-hop star's killing has been linked to a local gangland conflict.

item.title: US senators exempt HIV/Aids funding from planned spending cuts
item.description: While advancing a bill to claw back $9bn in federal spending, lawmakers spare the Pepfar programme from cuts.

item.title: Map shows more than 1,300 measles cases across U.S.
item.description: CBS News is tracking a outbreak of measles in West Texas that has led to the deaths of two children and a growing number of cases around the country.

item.title: Republicans press leaders of Georgetown, Berkeley and CUNY on antisemitism complaints
Immigration agency flexes authority to sharply expand detention without bond hearing
